cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles east of Andros Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest through the north-western Bahamas then turning north-northwest paralleling the east coast of Florida toward the southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible brush or brief landfall along the southeast Florida Atlantic coast (Boca Raton–Volusia/Flagler area) late 1–2 Aug; more likely landfall later in the Carolinas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch Hallandale Beach to south of Boca Raton FL; Tropical Storm Watch Volusia/Flagler County Line to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; Storm Surge Watch Jupiter Inlet to Ponte Vedra Beach FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Boca Raton to Volusia/Flagler County Line FL and Northwestern Bahamas; Tropical Storm Warning north of Ocean Reef to south of Boca Raton FL and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic side of the Florida peninsula, Georgia coast, and the Carolinas northward into the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands may bring occasional gusts 25–35 mph to the Tampa Bay area late Saturday through Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Gulf side; onshore flow remains weak.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of intermittent tropical downpours possible as outer bands cross the peninsula.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief reductions in visibility and increased lightning risk in squalls; potential vessel schedule disruptions due to precautionary routing around the peninsula.
